umd.cs.shop2
Class Shop

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--umd.cs.shop2.Shop
public final class Shop
extends java.lang.Object

This is the main class for the Java interface to SHOP2. The shop2 package enables the access of the SHOP2 hierarchical planning system from within Java. SHOP2 runs in Common Lisp; this package provides code and data structures for running SHOP2 in an external Lisp process and for accessing the results that SHOP2 produces.

The Java interface to SHOP2 has two major uses: (1) it can be run as a complete, stand-alone program; (2) it can be embedded in a seperate Java program to allow that program to use SHOP2's planning capabilities.

Field Detail

CONFIGFILE

static final java.lang.String CONFIGFILE
Name of file that holds configuration info (specifically SHOP2FILE).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SHOP2FILE

public static java.lang.String SHOP2FILE
File name for the SHOP2 program. The default value may be overridden by the configuration file, because some people will have SHOP2 installed in different locations.

JSHOP2FILE

public static final java.lang.String JSHOP2FILE
File name for the Lisp code that acts as a bridge between SHOP2 and this Java interface.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

tree

private TaskNode tree
The primary result of the SHOP2 planning process: the plan tree. This tree encodes not only the operators of the final plan (including the costs and ordering of the operators) but also the higher level tasks that were decomposed into those operators.

addList

private java.util.Vector addList
The list of atoms added to the state by the cumulative effect of all of the operators in the the plan produced when the Shop constructor was invoked (i.e., those atoms that are in the final state of the plan but not the start state).

deleteList

private java.util.Vector deleteList
The list of atoms deleted from the state by the cumulative effect of all of the operators in the the plan produced when the Shop constructor was invoked (i.e., those atoms that are in the start state of the plan but not the final state).

verbosity

private static int verbosity
A number from 0 to 3 specifying how much information should be provided to the user during planning. If verbosity is greater than 0, all text sent to or received from the Lisp process that runs SHOP2 is displayed. The verbosity number is also sent to the Lisp process, which adjusts the amount of information it sends based on the verbosity level (see the SHOP2 manual for details).

jl

private static Javalisp jl
The external Lisp process from which SHOP2 is run. This field is only used by the Shop object constructors, i.e., all access to Lisp is done when the object is created and subsequent accesses to the object merely invoke data that was stored in the Java process while the constructor was executing.

Note that this field is static. When a Shop constructor is finished, it leaves the Lisp process running; if another Shop object is constructed, it will use that same Lisp process rather than restarting Lisp.

Constructor Detail

Shop

public Shop(java.lang.String nameDomainFile,
            java.lang.String nameProblemFile)
This constructor starts SHOP2 (unless it is already running), and then loads the specified domain file and problem file, and then it has SHOP2 solve all of the problems that are defined in the problem file (printing the results as it goes). The tree, addList, and deleteList fields are set by this constructor to be the plan tree, add list, and delete list for the last problem solved.

This is the contructor invoked by the main routine. It is primarily created for use in stand-alone operation of SHOP2, and it does not provide much fine-grained control (i.e., it runs all of the plans in the given problem file and it prints out all of the results that it produces).

Parameters:
nameDomainFile - The path and file name for a file that contains a SHOP2 domain description (i.e., a defdomain or make-domain statement).
nameProblemFile - The path and file name for a file that contains one or more SHOP2 problem descriptions (i.e., defproblem or make-problem statements).
See Also:
other contructor

Shop

public Shop(java.lang.String nameDomainFile,
            State startState,
            TaskAtom task)
This constructor starts SHOP2 (unless it is already running), and then loads the specified domain file, and then it has SHOP2 create a plan for the specified task in the specified state. The tree, addList, and deleteList fields are set by this constructor to be the plan tree, add list, and delete list for the task and state.

This contructor is not used in stand-alone execution; it is intended for use in programs that embed this package. As such, it provides relatively fine-grained control over execution (i.e., it plans for a specified task in a specified domain and does not do anything with the result, since it is assumed that the calling program will access the results using the getTree, getAddList, and getDeleteList() methods).

Parameters:
nameDomainFile - The path and file name for a file that contains a SHOP2 domain description (i.e., a defdomain or make-domain statement).
startState - The world state at the start of the planning process. contains one or more SHOP2 problem descriptions (i.e., defproblem or make-problem statements).
task - The main task for which a plan should be created.
See Also:
other contructor
Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
The main routine for running the Java SHOP2 interface in stand alone mode. This routine is not used when the interface is embedded in another program. The main routine loads domain and problem files (specified on the command line), runs SHOP2 on those files, and then terminates SHOP2.

Parameters:
args - Command line arguments: domain file name, problem file name, optional verbosity
See Also:
Shop object constructor

getTree

public TaskNode getTree()
Returns:
The root node of a tree encoding the plan produced when the Shop constructor was invoked.

kill

public static void kill()
Terminates the external Lisp process that runs SHOP2.

printResults

public void printResults()
Prints the plan, the plan tree, the add list, and the delete list.

startDomain

private void startDomain(java.lang.String nameDomainFile)
First this routine starts SHOP2 if it is not already running. Then it loads the SHOP2 domain file.

start

public static void start()
This routine starts SHOP2 if it is not already running.

active

public static boolean active()
True if and only if the connection to SHOP2 has successfully been activated. External functions should not call Shop routines (other than start() and terminate() if this function returns false.

solveProblem

private void solveProblem(java.lang.String problemName)
Runs the main SHOP2 planning routine.

Parameters:
problemName - The name of a planning problem defined using a defproblem statement in SHOP2.

extractResults

private void extractResults(java.lang.String taskString)
Gets the tree, addList, and deleteList from a the completed execution of a single planning problem.

Parameters:
taskString - The task list portion of the original problem. If this list contains multiple tasks, the entire string is used as the name of a root node that combines all of the top level tasks in the tree. The taskString is ignored if the problem had only one top level task (this is always the case when this object was created using the constructor for embedded use because that constructor takes a single TaskAtom as an argument.

extractTree

private void extractTree(TaskNode parent)
Helper for extractResults(String) that recursively gets the tree from a completed execution of a single planning problem.

Parameters:
parent - The node from the higher level recursive call.

loadConfigFile

private void loadConfigFile()
Loads configuration information from CONFIGFILE
